description: Former England and Aston Villa striker Darius Vassell has announced his retirement at the age of 35 - nearly four years after his last game of football. The 35-year-old earned 22 caps for England.
title: Former England, Manchester City and Aston Villa striker Darius Vassell retires aged 35
title_page: Former England, Manchester City and Aston Villa striker Darius Vassell retires aged 35Â  | Daily Mail Online
text:
Former England and Aston Villa striker Darius Vassell has announced his retirement at the age of 35 - nearly four years after his last game of football.
The Sutton Coldfield-born player, who had been without a club since 2012, earned 22 England caps, scoring six goals, during the reign of manager Sven-Goran Eriksson.
He had spells with Manchester City, Turkish side Ankaragucu and Leicester after leaving Villa in 2005.
Former England and Aston Villa striker Darius Vassell has announced his retirement at the age of 35
Vassell won 22 England caps and scored six times, but also missed a penalty against Portugal in 2004
Vassell also played for Manchester City, Turkish side Ankaragucu and Leicester after leaving Villa in 2005
DARIUS VASSELL CAREER FACTFILE Aston Villa (1998-2005): 162 games, 35 goals Man City (2005-09): 103 games, 17 goals Ankaragucu (2009-10): 22 games, 4 goals Leicester (2010-12): 44 games, 6 goals England (2002-04): 22 games, 6 goals
In a statement released by his management company, Oporto Sports, Vassell said: 'I have enjoyed my career in football playing at the highest level, doing something I genuinely loved, and I felt that now was the right time to announce my retirement and look to the next phase of my life.'
Vassell said he will write a book about his career.
